snippet: A former military chief, Ismail Hakki Karadayi, and 102 other people went on trial Monday, charged with involvement in ousting an Islamist-oriented government in 1997.
abstract: Ismail Hakki Karadayi, former Turkish military chief, and 102 other people, go on trial charged with involvement in ousting an Islamist-oriented government in 1997; Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan's government has curtailed military's powers, and generals are being made to account for past interventions.
lead_paragraph: A former military chief, Ismail Hakki Karadayi, and 102 other people went on trial Monday, charged with involvement in ousting an Islamist-oriented government in 1997.

headline.main: Turkey: Ex-Military Chief Goes on Trial for 1997 Coup
headline.print_headline: Turkey: Ex-Military Chief Goes on Trial for 1997 Coup

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
